confirmed_facts: Fire broke out at 2:50â€¯p.m. local time on 26â€¯Novemberâ€¯2025 in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Taiâ€¯Po, Hongâ€¯Kong.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and about 10 people were injured.
The complex had 2,000 units with roughly 4,800 residents; 7 of 8 blocks were engulfed in flames.
Bamboo scaffolding used for maintenance work was present and reportedly helped spread the fire.
Firefighters rated the incident as a 5â€‘level fire and are conducting rescue operations.
No Korean nationals were reported among the casualties.

timeline.event: Fire in Taiâ€¯Po highâ€‘rise apartment complex; 13 fatalities, 10 injuries.
